intro: Kentrosphaera prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate kentrosphaera, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Kentrosphaera prostrata is typically found in moist, sandy soils in coastal or saline environments.
